verses.verse: Festus <WG5347> therefore<WG3767>, having come<WG1910> into the province<WG1885>, after<WG3326> three<WG5140> days<WG2250> went up<WG305> to<WG1519> Jerusalem<WG2414> from<WG575> Caesarea<WG2542>.

but <WG1161> had<WG2192> certain<WG5100> questions<WG2213> against<WG4314> him<WG846> of<WG4012> their own<WG2398> religion<WG1175>, and<WG2532> of<WG4012> one<WG5100> Jesus<WG2424>, who was dead<WG2348>, whom<WG3739> Paul<WG3972> affirmed<WG5335> to be alive<WG2198>.

And <WG1161> Agrippa<WG67> said<WG5346> unto<WG4314> Festus<WG5347>, I also<WG2532> could<WG1014> wish to hear<WG191> the man<WG444> myself<WG1161>. To-morrow<WG839>, saith he<WG5346>, thou shalt hear<WG191> him<WG846>.
